clinical_study.brief_title: Caregivers' Online Training for Recovery From Hip Fracture
clinical_study.official_title: Recovery After Hip Fracture: A Novel Online Intervention for Caregivers

brief_summary.textblock: This project will test feasibility to deliver an online education and skill development program for family/caregivers of older adults recovering from a surgically repaired low-trauma hip fracture. We will also recruit health professionals to review and provide feedback on the e-learning course before we test its feasibility and acceptability with caregivers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change before and immediately after taking the short online course, and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate (using a Likert scale 1 to 7) perceptions of acceptability of the (1) delivery mode and (2) program.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change before and immediately after taking the short online course, and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate (using a Likert scale 1 to 7) perceptions of feasibility of the (1) delivery mode and (2) program.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change before and immediately after taking the short online course, and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaires will assess participants' perceptions on technology usability (Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology).

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change before and immediately after taking the short online course, and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaires will assess participants' perceptions of self-efficacy (Modified Computer Self-Efficacy Scale) for using a computer and the online program.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessing change before and immediately after taking the short online course, and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: A quiz based on the information contained within the program will be administered.

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after the intervention and 3 months later
primary_outcome.description: A sub-sample of 20 caregivers (within 1 week of the intervention and 3 months later) will be invited to take part in semi-structured interviews by telephone to ask questions about program and delivery acceptability (including technology use) and the effect of caregiving on their everyday activities and health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire (Short Form)
Physical activity with a self-report questionnaire, the Community Healthy Activities Model Program for Seniors (CHAMPS)

intervention.description: Investigators will request that family/caregivers watch a self-paced (60-90 minutes) online e-learning training session for recovery after hip fracture.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Family/caregivers of old adults with hip fracture
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adults less than 19 years of age

patient_data.ipd_description: Investigators will ask participants' permission to share anonymized data in the consent form, but they can choose to opt out.
